The programme also revisits a property in Nottinghamshire, where a couple bought a former farm building at auction to turn into their dream 'forever home'

programme.title: B&B by the Sea
programme.desc: Nina Wadia was brought up near the coast in Hong Kong and has fond recollections of her time by the water, so her stay at the B&B is a chance to reminisce on her favourite memories of the seaside. However, the actress and comedian doesn't get to relax and is put to work bringing in the catch of the day - lobster. All that hard graft can't go to waste, because she's taught by chef Alex how to cook a decadent lobster linguine with wild garlic to celebrate the fresh catch. The next day offers her the opportunity to make chocolate truffles with a local chocolatier

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Celebrating the 70th anniversary of the first recorded summit of the highest point on earth, Mount Everest, Ellie Harrison heads to Kettering and one of the world's most advanced materials research facilities to put outdoor gear - and herself - to the test. As well as getting to grips with a pair of expedition boots that made it to the top of the world, how will Ellie bear up in a cold chamber where the mercury can hit -40 degrees centigrade? Ellie also dips into the Countryfile archive to remember some pretty bracing encounters with the worst the weather can hurl at people

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a special edition paying tribute to the nursing profession, filmed at St Thomas's and St Bartholomew's hospitals in the heart of London. The programme features objects that provide an insight into the history of nursing and healthcare, from medals awarded for bravery to early uniforms, cartoons and medical equipment. Fiona also meets comedian Jo Brand, a former psychiatric nurse, and hears the story of Jennifer Worth - the author of Call the Midwife

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: The countdown to Trixie and Matthew's wedding officially begins, with Sister Veronica taking charge of organising the wedding gifts, while the bride's brother Geoffrey arriving and setting out to arrange the perfect hen party. However, the nuptials cause stress levels to escalate as a catalogue of disasters threaten to spoil the day. Meanwhile, a car crash leaves Dr Turner facing the biggest test of his career when he left to save a precious life, Nancy considers her and Colette's future and Sister Julienne hatches a plan to save Nonnatus House once and for all

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: DCI Boyce sets up surveillance on Noye's house in Kent, and they soon strike lucky when they follow Brian Reader from the property to a gold merchants in Bristol. As the evidence builds, raids are organised to arrest the gang, only for the operation to end in tragedy

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents highlights and analysis of the Premier League match between Tottenham Hotspur and Chelsea at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. The London rivals shared the spoils in an entertaining 2-2 draw when they met at Stamford Bridge in August. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Mud (2012)
programme.desc: Two boys exploring an island on the Mississippi discover a fugitive has made his home there. He tells them he is on the run from bounty hunters after killing a man, and needs their help to be reunited with his lost love. As they ferry messages to the woman in question, the youngsters are forced to come to terms with the complexity of adult relationships. Drama, starring Matthew McConaughey and Reese Witherspoon

Several people had reason for wishing Arlena Stuart dead, but high on the list of suspects are her husband, teenage son and a troubled vicar. David Suchet, Hugh Fraser, Philip Jackson and Pauline Moran star

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The amateur sleuths are called to a monastery to restore a herb garden in time for a royal visit - but their pruning and planting is disrupted by the discovery of a corpse. As they investigate the death, the tight-knit community closes in around them. Mystery drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The duo help reorganise the seed museum owned by the descendants of famous botanist Edwin Pargeter - but it is not long before a man is found dead in the family's garden. In an effort to trace his killer, Rosemary involves colleagues from the Royal Horticultural Society at Kew Gardens, and soon the race is on to identify a batch of mysterious seeds before it falls into the wrong hands. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell help more people to reunite with long-lost relatives. Alice Jones was brought up by her father, but on a visit to her mother more than 50 years ago she met her younger brother called Sam and has always hoped that one day she would see him again. Mark Ratcliffe grew up in Lancashire and at the age of 12 his parents told him he was adopted and the revelation devastated him. Ever since, he cannot shake the question of how a mother could give up her child and is now looking for answers

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Home Sweet Home - Travels in My Own Land
programme.desc: After a lifetime of travels that have taken her across the globe, Joanna Lumley is making her most personal journey yet in the UK. Starting at Tilbury Docks in Essex she heads north, making a nostalgic return to Coronation Street, before ending the journey in Whitby

programme.title: Endeavour

programme.title: Heartbeat

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: The team is called to investigate the violent and peculiar murder of an Oxford college don, but when Thursday makes an unexpected discovery, Morse's suitability to work on the case is compromised and he is side-lined. Meanwhile, things at home become quite tense for Thursday and Win when they receive disturbing news from abroad.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Will is settling into the new routines of his life in Grantchester when an unexpected phone call reveals his father has got himself into some trouble, so he asks Geordie for his help. Will hasn't been home in a while, running from a past he wants to forget, but he cannot outrun his roots for ever and when one vicious beating leads to a grisly murder at a sprawling ancestral home, scandal threatens to engulf the Davenport family - suggesting life may never be the same for Will again. Jemma Redgrave and Nathaniel Parker guest star, alongside Robson Green and Tom Brittney

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Reeling from his family tragedy, Will seeks distraction in Geordie's world where a curious case unfolds concerning the murder of a Teddy Boy at a dance hall. The dead boy's pockets reveal a library card from Esme's school, and even more disturbing - a picture of Esme herself. Geordie makes a beeline for the school and grills his frightened daughter. She pleads ignorance, but Will knows something is up when he spots her hiding a love letter. Away from her life at the vicarage, Mrs Chapman feels lost, while Cathy is left shaken by another encounter at work. Robson Green and Tom Brittney star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Part one of two. While holidaying in Cornwall with his friend Captain Hastings, the sleuth meets a local woman who has seemingly become unaccountably accident-prone - but soon starts to suspect she is actually a victim of foul play. David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: An archaeologist posing as Rosemary dies mysteriously during a dig for Anglo-Saxon artefacts in the grounds of Lord Engleton's stately home, presenting the duo with a fresh mystery to solve. The gardens are unaccountably blighted by yellowing, forcing the estate to close its gates to the public, and a second death suggests somebody will go to any lengths for a piece of British history. Guest starring Julian Wadham

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are called in to investigate when gardens entered for a village contest are attacked by a disease. Further sinister undercurrents are exposed when reigning champion Donald Westward is found dead and recriminations start to fly as buried rivalries come to the surface. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: An old friend of the detective contacts him when his girlfriend is murdered, but the pipe-smoking sleuth finds the woman had more than one lover. Detective drama, starring Michael Gambon

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: A vital report is stolen from the home of a government minister, putting the reputation of high-ranking French officials at stake. Drama, starring Michael Gambon

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A young woman asks Poirot to investigate her father's murder - a 14-year-old crime for which her mother was found guilty and executed. The detective agrees to investigate, but warns his client that he may discover things she does not want to hear. David Suchet stars, with Rachael Stirling, Aidan Gillen, Aimee Mullens, Toby Stephens, Gemma Jones, Patrick Malahide and Annette Badland

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective investigates a double poisoning, aiming to prove the innocence of Elinor Carlisle, the chief suspect in the deaths of her aunt and her rival in love. However, it emerges that she is the only person with a motive, opportunity and means to administer the poison. Crime drama, starring David Suchet, Elisabeth Dermot-Walsh, Diana Quick, Paul McGann and Rupert Penry-Jones

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A fox-hunt turns sour when a tramp is found dead in the woods, and matters are further complicated by the murder of the chief suspect's father. As DCI Barnaby investigates, he concludes it is only a matter of time before another member of the tight-knit community suffers the same fate. Guest starring James Bolam

programme.title: Live Snooker: Players Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day six from Aldersley Village in Wolverhampton, featuring the concluding semi-final, played over the best of 11 frames. Eventual champion Neil Robertson was in fine form at this stage last year as he prevailed 6-1 against Jimmy Robertson to reach this final for the second time since the tournament replaced the Players Tour Championship Finals on the calendar in 2017. With analysis from Stephen Hendry, Alan McManus, Neal Foulds and Ken Doherty, commentary by David Hendon and Phil Yates, and reports from Rob Walker

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Former nanny Lavinia Seagram is found soaked in blood and it is believed she had turned to drink and drugs to commit suicide. Guest starring Jemima Rooper, Zoe Wanamaker and Peter Bowles, with David Suchet as the Belgian sleuth

programme.desc: Arthur buys a large consignment of wine, supposedly brewed by monks. Before he can collect his order it is impounded, but he sneaks into a warehouse and retrieves it anyway. programme.desc: Coverage of the evening session on day five from Aldersley Village in Wolverhampton, featuring the opening semi-final, played over the best of 11 frames. programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink worries he is being stalked by an unbalanced fan after receiving strange gifts with seemingly threatening messages attached. programme.title: Frasier

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: A caller to his radio show gives Frasier the impression Niles's wife Maris might be having an affair with her fencing instructor. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

He's proud to head an organisation that provides a fun and relaxed work environment, but now that the company is offering smart home technology, it's in competition with much larger organisations, and Todd wants to make sure it's fully prepared to take them on

programme.title: Channel 4 News Summary

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Pilot Rhys hosts the latest dinner party in Devon, but one of the guests is thrown out of an imaginary lifeboat and an interesting find leads to Rhys being mistaken for a stripper

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

programme.desc: In Devon, detective Steve is counting on a menu of bold and experimental flavours to win him the £1,000 prize. His feast of bold flavours goes down a storm with most of the guests, but also sparks a Pavlova row between Tina and Holly

programme.title: Inside
programme.desc: Revealing the story behind the luxury food emporium in Piccadilly, London, that has been at the centre of high society for three centuries, becoming synonymous with the finest of British produce. Throughout the documentary, former staff reveal secrets from the shop floor, and look back at some of the most famous faces to have visited the store over the years

programme.title: George V: Our Unexpected King
programme.desc: Behind his brother Edward in line to the throne, George V was shy, scared of public speaking, poorly educated and lacking refinement and could come across as cold and detached. But when Edward died from flu he not only inherited the crown, but married his brother's fiancee Mary, who shaped not only his future but that of the monarchy. This profile examines a king who reigned from 1910 to 1936 and took Britain into the First World War, changed the name and destiny of the royal family and challenged the establishment

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes tales of Kensington Palace, which started out as Nottingham House until it was bought in 1698 by William III and transformed into a royal residence after a major renovation. Kate Williams explores some of the more gruesome pieces of palace history, including the grim death of Henry Stuart, the murder of Amy Robsart to clear a path for the queen, and the amazing story of Eleanor Cobham, the 'Royal Witch'

programme.title: Harry Wild
programme.desc: Recently retired English professor Harriet 'Harry' Wild is trying to adjust to retirement when she's injured in a mugging. While recovering at the home of her police detective son Charlie, she looks at his files and realises his latest investigation bears similarities to an obscure Elizabethan play. But when her findings are rebuffed, she decides to find the killer-with aid from a surprising source. Drama, starring Jane Seymour

programme.title: Billy Connolly: In His Own Words

programme.title: We Love

programme.title: Secrets of the Factories
programme.desc: The Kellogg's factory in Manchester opens its doors to reveal how some of the nation's favourite breakfast cereals are made. Larger than Buckingham Palace, and running 24 hours a day, five days a week, the factory produces one million packets of cereal a day. Cameras spend a day there and follow the process of making Corn Flakes, Crunchy Nut Cornflakes, Rice Crispies, and Coco Pops, with members of the workforce as guides

programme.title: The Stonehenge Enigma: What Lies Beneath
programme.desc: Stonehenge is one of the world's greatest mysteries. Now, a new discovery found deep in the soil of the surrounding area is threatening to upturn everything we think we know about this 4,500 year-old landmark. Rob Bell joins archaeologists, scientists and engineers who have uncovered a vast, previously undetected monument that is many times the size of the original henge

programme.title: Dinosaur with Stephen Fry
programme.desc: The actor finds himself transported back to a huge forest 68 million years ago in the late Cretaceous period, home to deadly predator Tyrannosaurus rex. With the help of expert Dr David Hone, Stephen observes a T-rex on the rampage, crunching up huge corpses and stalking a herd of triceratops, and they also encounter a giant flying reptile known as quetzalcoatlus. which stood taller than a giraffe and had the wingspan of a light aircraft

programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting
programme.desc: Sue has had enough when Noel misses the start of another family holiday, so he is forced to think about his priorities and decides to step back from his role at the bakery.. But will more time at home lead to a harmonious household? When it comes to who will take on the extra responsibilities in Noel's absence, Chloe and Luke go head-to-head in the battle for control

programme.title: Beyond the Yorkshire Farm: Reuben & Clive
programme.desc: Reuben Owen and his father Clive travel beyond their remote hill farm in the Yorkshire Dales to embark on an exciting digging business venture together. Reuben is commissioned to dig a series of wilderness ponds in the village of Langwathby in Cumbria. It's his biggest job to date, and to cope with the burgeoning workload Reuben recruits girlfriend Sarah and best friend Tom to help him. Later, Reuben wins a contract to haul huge oak beams for a friend's stone barn renovation

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth (1954)
programme.desc: The son of a disgraced medieval nobleman is raised in poverty. With the support of a kindly earl, he gains the chance to train as a knight and reclaim his birthright, proving his worth by fighting to foil a plot to overthrow the king. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, David Farrar and Barbara Rush

programme.title: The Gentle Sex (1943)
programme.desc: Seven women from vastly different backgrounds are brought together as volunteers in the Auxiliary Territorial Service during the Second World War. Despite their differences they become firm friends during training and on assignment driving military transport and operating anti-aircraft guns. Drama, starring Rosamund John, Joan Greenwood, Lilli Palmer, John Justin and Joan Gates

programme.title: Night Passage (1957)
programme.desc: The black sheep of a family falls in with a gang of outlaws plotting to rob a train operated by his strait-laced brother, but reckons without his sibling's determination to track him down and set him back on the straight and narrow. Western, starring James Stewart, Audie Murphy, Dan Duryea and Brandon de Wilde

programme.title: Yangtse Incident (1957)
programme.desc: A British frigate is heavily shelled and captured by Chinese communists on the Yangtse River in 1949. After a failed rescue mission by a sister ship, the remaining crew members put into action a daring escape plan that involves disguising the vessel and slipping her moorings under the cover of darkness. Fact-based action adventure, starring Richard Todd, William Hartnell and Akim Tamiroff

programme.title: Fantastic Four (2015)
programme.desc: A gifted young scientist joins members of a secret project researching inter-dimensional travel, and they return from a journey to another world with superhuman powers. Their abilities make them the only hope for Earth's survival when a colleague who was lost on their expedition returns to wreak vengeance. Superhero adventure, starring Miles Teller, Michael B Jordan, Kate Mara and Jamie Bell

programme.title: Pixie (2020)
programme.desc: To avenge her mother's death, a young woman named Pixie masterminds a heist but must flee across Ireland from gangsters, take on the patriarchy, and choose her own destiny along the way. Crime comedy, starring Olivia Cooke, Fra Fee and Rory Fleck Byrne

programme.title: Bull (2021)
programme.desc: After a decade away, gangland enforcer Bull returns to the streets where he used to do the bidding of his father-in-law, sadistic mob boss Norm. The men fell out when Norm's daughter Gemma developed a drug addiction and Bull demanded sole custody of their son, Aiden. Bull's return ignites the fuse on an orgy of violence targeted at the crime lord and his minions. Thriller, starring Neil Maskell, David Hayman and Tamzin Outhwaite

programme.title: Kill List (2011)
programme.desc: A hitman with money worries is persuaded by his old partner to take on one last job. The duo's mysterious client presents them with a list of three targets, but as they go about their deadly work, they start to realise there is something far more disturbing going on than a simple act of murder. Thriller, with Neil Maskell, Michael Smiley and MyAnna Buring

programme.title: The Devil's Doorway (2018)
programme.desc: In the autumn of 1960, Father Thomas Riley and Father John Thornton are sent by the Vatican to investigate a miraculous event in an Irish home for 'fallen women', only to uncover something much more terrifying. Horror, starring Lalor Roddy, Ciaran Flynn and Helena Bereen

programme.title: The Secret of Kells (2009)
programme.desc: A boy living in a medieval monastery under constant attack by Viking raiders acquires an unfinished book of mystical knowledge. The task of completing the tome falls to him, so he ventures into a haunted forest in search of the secrets required, where he must face his own darkest fears. Animated fantasy adventure, with the voices of Evan McGuire, Christen Mooney and Brendan Gleeson

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go! (1966)
programme.desc: International Rescue is called in to save the first manned space mission to Mars from sinister hijacker The Hood, and ensure a second attempt goes to plan. Puppet adventure based on Gerry Anderson's TV series, featuring the voices of Shane Rimmer, Ray Barrett, Alexander Davion, Peter Dyneley, Sylvia Anderson and Cliff Richard, voicing a puppet version of himself

programme.title: Rat Race (2001)
programme.desc: A casino magnate approaches a group of no-hopers with the offer of $2million to whoever retrieves the sum from a locker in a train station in New Mexico, prompting a madcap cross-continent dash. Meanwhile, the casino owner's high-rolling gambler friends place bets on which of the bumbling contestants will win. Comedy, with Rowan Atkinson, John Cleese, Whoopi Goldberg, Kathy Bates, Seth Green and Cuba Gooding Jr

programme.title: Turner & Hooch (1989)
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detective's well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood (2019)
programme.desc: In 1998, magazine journalist Lloyd Vogel is sent to interview beloved TV entertainer Fred Rogers, an assignment he feels is beneath him. However, a friendship soon forms between the two men. Director Marielle Heller's drama based on a true story, starring an Oscar and Bafta-nominated Tom Hanks, Matthew Rhys and Chris Cooper

programme.title: The Hitman's Bodyguard (2017)
programme.desc: A disgraced bodyguard is hired to protect a hitman about to testify against the tyrannical president of Belarus at the International Criminal Court in exchange for the release of his wife from prison. Comedy action thriller, starring Ryan Reynolds, Samuel L Jackson, Gary Oldman and Salma Hayek

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47 (2015)
programme.desc: The latest in a long line of genetically engineered clones bred to be the perfect assassin takes on a mission that strikes close to home. A corporation intends to use the technology that created him to build an army of superhuman killers. As the assassin fights to bring them down, he uncovers the dark secrets surrounding his origin. Action thriller, starring Rupert Friend, Hannah Ware and Zachary Quinto

programme.title: Legend (1985)
programme.desc: A peasant boy, who has a special bond with animals and fairies, shows his sweetheart the last surviving unicorns. Unfortunately, a monstrous demon and his goblin henchmen despise the mythical creatures and trick the girl into harming one of them, forcing Jack to act quickly to save her immortal soul. Ridley Scott's fantasy adventure, starring Tom Cruise, Mia Sara, Tim Curry and David Bennent

programme.title: Cutthroat Island (1995)
programme.desc: A tough female pirate enlists the help of an educated slave in finding the three parts of a map leading to buried treasure. However, one of the pieces is in the hands of her cruel uncle, and she also has to find the loot before her crew mutinies or the British Navy catches up with her. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella and Maury Chaykin

programme.title: Crocodile Dundee II (1988)
programme.desc: The rugged Australian adventurer sets out to save his reporter girlfriend from New York drug dealers. Having rescued her from their clutches, he realises they will soon be coming after him - so he decides to even the odds by luring them to the Outback for a final showdown. Comedy adventure sequel, starring Paul Hogan, Linda Kozlowski, John Meillon and Charles S Dutton

programme.title: City Slickers (1991)
programme.desc: Three middle-aged men take a break from the rat race and their mid-life crises to join a two-week cattle drive from New Mexico to Colorado. Together with a bunch of fellow urbanites, they find the going much tougher than expected, and it is down to a real-life cowboy to whip them into shape. Comedy adventure, starring Billy Crystal, Daniel Stern, Bruno Kirby and Jack Palance, who won an Oscar for his performance as grizzled trail boss Curly

programme.title: Star Trek Into Darkness (2013)
programme.desc: Captain Kirk and the crew of the starship Enterprise are sent on a clandestine mission into enemy territory to track down the rogue Starfleet agent behind a terrorist attack on Earth. However, the assignment brings to light a hidden threat from within their own organisation. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Benedict Cumberbatch

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence (2016)
programme.desc: Two decades have passed since Earth was saved from an extraterrestrial invasion, and in the years since, the aliens' salvaged technology has been used to transform the world. However, it may not be enough to save the human race when a second, even deadlier attack begins. Sci-fi adventure, starring Jeff Goldblum, Liam Hemsworth and Bill Pullman

programme.title: Mechanic: Resurrection (2016)
programme.desc: Hitman Arthur Bishop's arch-enemy Crain kidnaps his new girlfriend Gina and blackmails him into committing three assassinations in as many days, while making them look like accidents. Action thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham, Jessica Alba, Sam Hazeldine and Tommy Lee Jones

programme.title: Last Orders (2001)
programme.desc: Four men visit Margate to scatter the ashes of a beloved lifelong friend. They stop at a number of places on the way, where they recall fond memories of the deceased and reminisce about their shared experiences over the last six decades. Drama, based on the novel by Graham Swift, with Michael Caine, Bob Hoskins, Tom Courtenay, David Hemmings, Ray Winstone and Helen Mirren

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Nancy and Beau a. re called in during half term to help Sally with another inspection. Elsewhere, Peri has a big surprise in store for Juliet

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

First he visits the Spanish Pavillion in New Jersey, then heads to California to see the owners of Kingston Cafe, French-themed La Frite, and Capri

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps husband and wife, George and Lennox Thomas find their ideal holiday home in and around the Spanish area of Marina Almeria to escape their busy London lives. With a budget of £150,000, Jonnie Irwin delivers five property options that cater for both their family and double up as the perfect work retreat

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A Yorkshire glampsite owner diversifies into olive oil farming in Italy, a cook from Birmingham teaches vegan cooking in France, and a couple are determined to rebuild their lives in Spain

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole visit the Cotswolds, where they unearth a mystery item that looks like a fish tank, but turns out to have a very different use entirely

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to the Chiltern Hills in Buckinghamshire to meet Adam and Mandy, who run a classic car restoration business. Henry uncovers an anvil, while Simon finds an old brown dresser, which he thinks could become a wildlife sanctuary for birds and insects

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Aftrt a ballroom-dancing fanatic dies without leaving a will, the race is on to find heirs to his valuable estate. The search for relatives of a South Shields woman reveals fascinating links to India and the Yemen. Plus, details of two unclaimed estates where heirs still need to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Church Street Cobbles, a B&B that foodie Debbie Quinn and housekeeper, cook and cleaner Isobel Reisen recently opened above a barber shop in Macclesfield. Guests John and Joy are amazed by the cleanliness, but Steve and Verity aren't impressed with their bathroom. During an afternoon of foraging in the woods, Debbie and Isobel get competitive, while Arun and his sister Rashmi show off their skills. Expectations are high at breakfast, but Debbie's locally sourced produce comes under fire from Steve and Verity, and their feedback is hard to swallow

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to rock 'n' roll venue the Victoria Bikers Pub in Coalville, Leicestershire, where siblings John and Joy take a more laid back approach to running the business

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Cranberries Hideaway in Kilmington, Devon, where owner Steve and his partner Verity hope the luxury touches will win over their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guests head to the Mehfil Hotel in Southall, London, where spiritual host Arun and his sister Rashmi are hoping to bring some Indian hospitality to the competition

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet for one last time to find out what they have been paid. Debbie and Isobel are keen to get to the bottom of some of the cleaning comments from Steve and Verity

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer go house hunting in Surrey and the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames. Phil is with married couple Mike and David, who are returning from Central America and want their first home together, - whilst Kirstie is with science teachers Kat and Pat, who desperately want a place of their own before wedding bells ring for them in a few months

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet Amber and Martin Brammah in Waterbeach, Cambridgeshire, who are undecided on whether they should sell their home or completely renovate it. Amber owns a fitness company and runs classes from home, and feels a bigger property would be better for her business. However, Martin feels that it would be better to use their budget to renovate their current family home

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman is on the Greek island of Crete, showing five properties to childhood sweethearts Catherine and Patrick from Leeds. They've been married for over 20 years and cannot wait to enjoy extended holidays in Crete in a property which can also accommodate their two teenage sons. Jasmine shows them five properties for their £150,000 budget

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: The six remaining potters discover their wild sides, as they create metallic-effect endangered animal sculptures fired in oil drums, before judges Keith and Rich set a surprise second challenge to throw a tall, thin-necked vase. Who will beast their way to the quarter-final, and who will be heading home?

programme.title: The Wall: Cover Your Tracks
programme.desc: Celine tries to prove there is a connection between the murders of Justine and Gregoire. However, Jacques refuses to admit the existence of a serial killer in Fermont and doesn't send reinforcements. Meanwhile, Robert receives a disturbing video. Canadian mystery drama, starring Isabel Richer and Alexandre Landry. In French

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The team treats two trauma patients arriving by helicopter on the hospital's new helipad. Eric, 75, collapsed shortly after falling from a ladder while pruning trees in his garden. He is stabilised and put in an induced coma while a CT scan is used to determine any internal injuries. IT consultant Mihhail, 29, is admitted after crashing his motorbike at high speed and again a CT scan is employed to look for hidden wounds. He's later transferred to the Intensive Care Unit while specialists decide how to repair the damage to his liver and stop his internal bleeding. Meanwhile, 22-year-old performing arts student Maria complains of chest pains and 82-year-old Rusty is treated for a broken ankle sustained in a road accident

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Freddie, seven, is brought in after falling several metres from a tree in his garden. He's been in and out of consciousness and doctors are concerned he could have head or spinal injuries. Martin, 66, collapsed at home and spent the night on the floor, and he's now experiencing poor eyesight and dizziness. The stroke team diagnoses a blood clot, but because of the amount of time that has passed since the incident, clot-busting drugs will have little effect. Elsewhere, eight-year-old Jayden has come to St George's with swollen eyes, the result of severe hay fever

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the words-and-numbers panel game, with Sean Lock and guest captain Joe Wilkinson joined by Seann Walsh and Danny Dyer. Susie Dent is in Dictionary Corner, receiving a helping hand from Bill Bailey, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: The team treats two trauma patients arriving by helicopter on the hospital's new helipad. Eric, 75, collapsed shortly after falling from a ladder while pruning trees in his garden. He is stabilised and put in an induced coma while a CT scan is used to determine any internal injuries. IT consultant Mihhail, 29, is admitted after crashing his motorbike at high speed and again a CT scan is employed to look for hidden wounds. He's later transferred to the Intensive Care Unit while specialists decide how to repair the damage to his liver and stop his internal bleeding. Meanwhile, 22-year-old performing arts student Maria complains of chest pains and 82-year-old Rusty is treated for a broken ankle sustained in a road accident

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Freddie, seven, is brought in after falling several metres from a tree in his garden. He's been in and out of consciousness and doctors are concerned he could have head or spinal injuries. Martin, 66, collapsed at home and spent the night on the floor, and he's now experiencing poor eyesight and dizziness. The stroke team diagnoses a blood clot, but because of the amount of time that has passed since the incident, clot-busting drugs will have little effect. Elsewhere, eight-year-old Jayden has come to St George's with swollen eyes, the result of severe hay fever

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman shows five properties to recently married Londoners Katy and Dom, who want to buy a holiday home in the Cádiz area of south-west Spain. With a budget of up to £180,000, will any of the five properties Jasmine has lined up to show them be their perfect place in the sun?

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty, Kate Quilton and Matt Tebbutt present some of their favourite investigations. Kate heads to Spain in pursuit of the perfect tomato and finds herself slap bang in the middle of the world's biggest food fight. Jimmy visits Italy to investigate the difference between risotto rice and long grain. Matt finds out why pork scratchings aren't made from British pigs

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Radio broadcaster Toby Anstis loves Ibiza and having enjoyed many holidays there for 20 years now wants to buy his own bolthole. With help from his twin sister Kate, and with a budget of £250,000, he asks Laura Hamilton to show him the best property the island has to offer

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Scarlette Douglas helps Martyn and Anne Golesworthy find a holiday home on the Greek island of Naxos, which holds a special place in their hearts as the place they got married

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Russell Lovatt from Nottingham has been visiting Malta for the last 40 years. Now, with help from his daughter Sian, he is looking for the perfect property for a complete relocation, but they have very different opinions about what sort of home Russell should buy. With a budget of £200,000, can Laura Hamilton find a property with the wow factor to impress them both?

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples searching in the Scottish capital. Zoe and Jason are returning to their native Edinburgh after a decade living and working in Hong Kong. They have £950,000 but that will only buy them a flat around their preferred area. Can Phil fulfil their expensive wishlist? Kirstie is with Tan, from Lisbon, and his Fife-born wife Stephanie, who cannot agree on a countryside feel or city vibe

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples searching the south east. English-born Tom and his Floridian wife Kaitlyn have only seen a handful of properties, so balancing his desire for a vegetable garden with her American dream of a big open-plan living space proves a difficult balance for Kirstie. Phil helps Pete and Georgie, who moved into a studio flat right before the lockdown in spring 2020 and are desperate for more space. Wanting to start a family, they're after something to grow into, but Pete is conscious of value for money

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Theatre enthusiast Jay Coleman hosts the first party in Newport, Gwent, putting on a dramatic evening with an international menu, in the hope of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Peace activist Pippa Bartolotti hosts the second of the week's dinner parties in Newport, Gwent, serving up a menu of locally sourced vegetarian food and hoping to entertain her guests by indulging in a spot of fortune-telling. However, a talkative Duncan Powell threatens to dominate proceedings

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Radio journalist Emma Jones hosts the third dinner party in Newport, Gwent, serving up an American-themed menu of crab cakes and pulled pork, and the 23-year-old tries to boost her chances of taking home the prize money with a cheerleading session

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housewife Sarah Kinnear hosts the fourth dinner party in Newport, Gwent, and her guests are encouraged to attend wearing 'Welsh icon' attire. However, she takes a gamble when she engages in a lively dinner-table debate with Duncan and Pippa

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Recruitment boss Duncan Powell hosts the final dinner party in Newport, Gwent, and hopes his Hawaiian-themed evening will impress his guests enough to win the prize. Unfortunately for him, prawn brains and sea bass bones harm his chances of success, so the confident cook tries to rescue the evening with a lemon posset

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Farmer's daughter Mandy Sowray and her friend Anny Harrison host first at Laskill Country House in Helmsley, North Yorkshire. Chris Witton and Saroop Ram from the Swan Hotel feel right at home, but tech-savvy Colin and Ben Warburg from Scalford Hall Hotel fail to connect from the start. During the afternoon's hay-bale race, youngsters Charlie Thompson and Lauren Tucker from the Abbey Hotel fail to stack up to the challenge. At dinner, Mandy bigs up her banger qualifications, but at breakfast she fails to crack Chris's order. Colin's feedback leaves unanswered questions for Mandy

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris Witton and his spiritual friend Rammy hope that straightforward value for money will win them the competition, as they host at the Swan Hotel in Telford. A Yorkshire pudding-making competition leaves confident cooks Mandy and Anny thinking there's more to youngsters Charlie and Lauren than meets the eye. At dinner, Rammy opens up about his troubled past. Colin has a rude awakening in the morning. At feedback time, Chris has a change of heart about some of his guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Colin Warburg and his student son Ben hope that their 81-room country pile - Scalford Hall Hotel in Melton Mowbray, Leicestershire - will wow their rivals. However, Chris and Rammy are still smarting from their feedback and think that Colin is playing games. After an afternoon crate stacking competition on the hotel's high wire course, Colin gets a grilling at dinner. A lukewarm reaction to breakfast only adds to Colin's woes and when he sees his feedback he suspects that retribution is at hand

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the Abbey Hotel in Battle, East Sussex, run by confident young colleagues Charlie Thompson and Lauren Tucker. However when Charlie and Lauren's guests arrive, Colin and Ben feel the squeeze and Chris and Rammy find themselves in a sticky situation. On an afternoon at the archery range, scores are settled. At dinner, straight-talking Chris can't help but be impressed, but when the conversation turns to parking, the guests are in a jam with their hosts. Later, Colin's feedback leaves Lauren wanting answers

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners meet up to settle some scores. Laskill Country House host Mandy wants to crack where she went wrong with breakfast and why Colin and Ben failed to connect with her, while Chris and Rammy from The Swan Hotel wish to question Lauren on her room flaws and get to the bottom of Colin's bedroom nightmares

programme.title: Amanda Owen's Farming Lives
programme.desc: Amanda visits the Rose family on FarmEco in Nottinghamshire, an eco-focused business and one-stop shop for the community as it hosts several tenant businesses including a sheep farmer and a hair salon. She also turns her hand to woodwork at a workshop session for retired men hosted by a member of the family, goes foraging in an art therapy class and heads to the on-farm hairdressers for a trim

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Retired builder Roger has fallen 13ft from his daughter's roof and the trauma team is concerned he may have badly injured his head, back and neck. Folk musician Tad, 29, has come to A&E after developing a dangerously high heart rate, and doctors must use an electric shock to try to get it back to normal. Meanwhile, 69-year-old Richard is brought in after being found unwell at home by his son, and there are fears he has developed a serious infection

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Will, 13, arrives by helicopter after a serious collision with someone during a game of baseball, while in the paediatric area, teenage parents Connor and Saffron have arrived with their six-month-old daughter Amira, concerned about the irregular heartbeat their GP spotted. Pizza delivery rider Chris, 20, is brought in to resus following a motorbike accident. Series following life inside the A&E department of St George's Hospital, south-west London

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy words-and-numbers quiz, with Sean Lock and Johnny Vegas taking on guest captain Sarah Millican and Rob Beckett. Susie Dent presides in Dictionary Corner, ably assisted by Vic Reeves, and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Sean Lock is joined by Andrew Flintoff to battle guest captain Bill Bailey and team-mate Roisin Conaty as Jimmy Carr hosts another edition of the game show mash-up. Susie Dent is ably assisted by Rob Beckett in the Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley deals with the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Retired builder Roger has fallen 13ft from his daughter's roof and the trauma team is concerned he may have badly injured his head, back and neck. Folk musician Tad, 29, has come to A&E after developing a dangerously high heart rate, and doctors must use an electric shock to try to get it back to normal. Meanwhile, 69-year-old Richard is brought in after being found unwell at home by his son, and there are fears he has developed a serious infection

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Will, 13, arrives by helicopter after a serious collision with someone during a game of baseball, while in the paediatric area, teenage parents Connor and Saffron have arrived with their six-month-old daughter Amira, concerned about the irregular heartbeat their GP spotted. Pizza delivery rider Chris, 20, is brought in to resus following a motorbike accident. Series following life inside the A&E department of St George's Hospital, south-west London

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Wiltshire mother and daughter Emma and Charlotte have a budget of £100,000 for a holiday home in Antequera in Spain where they hope to spend more quality time together as a family. Jasmine Harman pulls out all the stops to show five suitable properties

programme.title: George Clarke's Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: The architect meets a West Sussex couple planning to build a house on the back of an old trailer, while in Wiltshire, a single mother plans to transform an old military helicopter, and a water tower undergoes a surprising conversion in Warwickshire. George's tour of Spain continues in northern Andalusia, where he visits a cave-style retreat quarried deep into the mountains

programme.title: Ugly House to Lovely House with George Clarke
programme.desc: The idyllic village of Hartley Wintney is often voted one of the best places to live in Britain - but every rose has its thorn. Fiona and Hugh's ugly Hampshire home has not been touched in decades, and they hate absolutely everything except the garden. They have £180,000 budget to transform the entire house, so George enlists award-winning architect Greg Blee. However, while the owners buy into his modernist scheme the local planners do not. Can he salvage his design and come up with a scheme that will tick all the boxes?

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The presenter attempts to unlock the potential of old houses, including the rules when it comes to putting a kitchen in a period home. He also meets a woman who bought a 400-year-old Devon cottage, and has some solutions for turning this old house into a new home

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Simran Samra hosts the first party in east London, and decides to cook meat for her main course, despite being a vegetarian. The fashionista tries to salvage her chances of winning the £1,000 prize by performing a range of comedy accents after fellow competitor Alan Price upsets one of the guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Comedian Yoshki Greenberg hosts the second dinner party in east London, but her decision to surprise the guests by asking them to wear animal-themed pyjama suits does not go down well - leaving her struggling to win them over with a stand-up routine

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Alan Price hosts the third party in east London, and sets out to impress his fellow competitors with a medieval-themed dinner. He hopes to raise the standard of the contest with an ambitious menu, but stumbles at the first hurdle when vegetarian diner Simran Samra panics at the sight of his authentic pig's head as the table centrepiece. Things do not improve as the night goes on, with dirty dinner plates and sloppy hosting leaving the guests less than impressed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Bar owner Delia Elliot hosts the fourth dinner party from east London, and she is confident she can teach her young diners the protocol of entertaining guests. However, prankster Alan Price ends up having an argument with her, leading Simran Samra to take evasive action

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Doctor Chintu Gademsetty hosts the final dinner party in east London, and is confident of impressing his guests with a 1980s-themed evening. Even though his dance competition is not a hit with all of the diners, his food goes down a treat, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at Oaklea Barns Guest House on Merseyside, where Mandi Magee and her partner Paul Green think their impeccable standards will wow their rivals. Guest Ian loves his room but is perplexed by plastic on the lampshades, while Mark and Natalie are thrown by a loose loo. During an exercise in falconry, Dave and Sanchia cry foul when chirpy Mandi rules the roost. At breakfast, Mandi makes it clear she thinks she can't be beaten, but Dave and Sanchia say they'll rise to the challenge

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Guest House Worsthorne in Lancashire, where partners Dave Rogers and Sanchia Crossley aim to win over their guests

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the group heads to the Sleeperdorm Backpacker Hotel in Newcastle, where Ian Nicholls hopes his guests will enjoy his cheap and cheerful concept

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B battle continues at the Parsonage Hotel and Spa near York, a 55-room country manor which wows the guests with its size, although Mandi's high cleaning standards are not met

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition sees the B&B owners meet for the last time to find out what they've been paid and to settle some scores. Oaklea Barns is first, and hosts Mandi and Paul want answers from Mark and Natalie, which ends up fanning flames

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Posh girl-about-town Liv Sargeant hosts the first party in Bath, and hopes to impress with her sophisticated evening, complete with black-tie dress code. However, her unusual choice of entertainment, and her undying love for Michael Buble, threaten to hamper her chances of winning the £1,000 prize at the end of the week

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former raver Mel Lewis-Leger hosts the second dinner party in Bath, but her taste in music and a spicy Cajun menu prove off-putting for some of the guests. Meanwhile, cafe worker Becky Tyler becomes more sociable, until she decides to do an impression of one of her fellow diners

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Handyman Jon Wicheard hosts the third dinner party in Bath. Denis Verrier suspects the food will not be up to his exacting standards, and sandwich enthusiast Becky Tyler also doubts the meal will be a success. The prospect of a disco excites vegetarian and former raver Mel Lewis-Leger, but society girl Liv Sargeant dreads the thought of any form of forced entertainment

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cafe worker Becky Tyler hosts the fourth dinner-party challenge from Bath. The theme is a 'Mad Hat' tea party, and she sets out to put on a menu of British classics, but the round of sandwiches for starters might prove too much for the diners

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Patriotic Frenchman Denis Verrier hosts the final dinner party in Bath, and hopes his experience of working in the hospitality industry will stand him in good stead. However, two of the guests are shocked by what they find in his wardrobe, and his staging of a penalty shoot-out provides more surprises, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Medics battle to keep 48-year-old Paul alive as he suffers a series of heart attacks. Roger's emergency stop halts his day at a scooter rally while, in Cumbria, there's a dramatic mountainside rescue for seriously injured cyclist Nick

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary following life inside the A&E department of St George's in south-west London. Carole, aged 45, is brought in after collapsing at home with chest pains. Tests reveal she has suffered a heart attack, so she undergoes an emergency procedure to unblock an artery. Philip, a 53-year-old psychiatrist, is rushed in following a seizure. Doctors suspect he might have suffered a stroke, but when it is revealed he was diagnosed with lung cancer several months earlier, registrar Chris believes it could be related. Finally, doctors treat 25-year-old Lucy, who is suffering severe headaches brought on by the build-up of excess spinal fluid in her head

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: A German tourist breaks her ankle while walking on a remote hillside, leaving her stranded. A quad bike rider comes off travelling at 50mph on a racetrack in Strathaven. Arriving on scene, medics must treat the patient's fractured arm immediately, before transporting him back to Glasgow for further treatment. On a small country road in rural Aberdeenshire, an 80-year-old lady is trapped in her car

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Compilation episode of the most dramatic motorbike incidents the medics have dealt with. The team is pushed to its limit in a bid to save the life of motorcyclist Pete. Ian is in a critical condition after a crash in the Lake District, while in Berkshire, biker Hanna is trapped with multiple injuries after ploughing into a road sign

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Documentary following life inside the A&E department of St George's in south-west London. Carole, aged 45, is brought in after collapsing at home with chest pains. Tests reveal she has suffered a heart attack, so she undergoes an emergency procedure to unblock an artery. Philip, a 53-year-old psychiatrist, is rushed in following a seizure. Doctors suspect he might have suffered a stroke, but when it is revealed he was diagnosed with lung cancer several months earlier, registrar Chris believes it could be related. Finally, doctors treat 25-year-old Lucy, who is suffering severe headaches brought on by the build-up of excess spinal fluid in her head

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
programme.desc: A German tourist breaks her ankle while walking on a remote hillside, leaving her stranded. A quad bike rider comes off travelling at 50mph on a racetrack in Strathaven. Arriving on scene, medics must treat the patient's fractured arm immediately, before transporting him back to Glasgow for further treatment. On a small country road in rural Aberdeenshire, an 80-year-old lady is trapped in her car

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Medics battle to keep 48-year-old Paul alive as he suffers a series of heart attacks. Roger's emergency stop halts his day at a scooter rally while, in Cumbria, there's a dramatic mountainside rescue for seriously injured cyclist Nick

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin is on the Canary Island of Tenerife helping husband and wife Teresa and Robin find their dream holiday home that they hope to retire to in the future. Having visited the island six times in the last few years, it's quickly become their favourite place. With five options lined up for their £120,000 budget, will they find what they're looking for?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Secrets of the Supercars
programme.desc: A visit to a secretive production facility in Sweden to look at the Koenigsegg Regera. Titch Cormack lifts the lid on the world's first supercar, the Jaguar XK120

programme.title: Fast Justice
programme.desc: The Sentinels lay a trap for a luxury car carrying a high value target and a couple claiming they were having brunch might be hiding something

programme.title: Cops on the Rock
programme.desc: Gibraltar's armed police officers arrest a man accused of making death threats to police, and Customs officers search a huge cargo boat from Colombia

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: Set on beautiful, scattered islands connected by the Pacific ocean in the Palawan province of the Philippines, this season of Survivor sees eighteen diverse castaways from South Africa's rainbow nation fighting it out to become the Sole Survivor, including one wild-card entry - a fan who clinched a spot on the show beating other wannabe Survivor contenders at a gruelling public outdoor event

programme.title: Rick Stein's Mediterranean Escapes
programme.desc: The chef experiences the bustling and colourful fish market in the Sicilian city of Catania and discovers dishes developed through centuries of poverty in Puglia on Italy's mainland. However, he is shocked to wake up one morning to find his vehicle is missing

programme.title: Special Ops: Crime Squad UK
programme.desc: A never-before-seen look into the real-life criminal investigations of the UK's most talented and successful sleuths who tackle some of the UK's most challenging criminal cases.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Inspector Dave Corcoran calls on his friend to turn what looks like a tug boat into a police vessel. Meanwhile, the team fix up a car whose tyres were slashed whilst on duty

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Creativity meets chaos French-style down a course littered with obstacles in the hills of Peche David overlooking Toulouse

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Bill Bailey, Colin Lane and Desiree Burch join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer host Sandi Toksvig's questions on the theme 'Overseas', in an extended edition of the unorthodox quiz. During the course of the show, the panellists find out about Allotment Annies as well as who keeps their brothers in a cage. The fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers the questionmaster considers most interesting, though not necessarily correct

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Joe Thomas grapples grumpily with some awkward hand-wear, Sian Gibson seems to find proof that she may be psychic and Iain Stirling shows some tasty shortbread who's boss

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nihal Arthanayake, Jake Humphrey, Patsy Kensit and Mae Martin go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games for the final time, prior to the week's overall winner being declared

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian David Mitchell, tennis coach Judy Murray and Countryfile presenter Anita Rani to vent their spleen about people and objects that upset them. Their gripes include sniffing, walking and eating, and sugar lumps

The fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers the questionmaster considers most interesting, though not necessarily correct

programme.title: Taskmaster

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy pop out on a last-minute Christmas Eve mission, leaving their youngsters in the apparently capable hands of Geoffrey - cutting more of a strict and stuffy Victorian gent than usual - and wife Wendy. Alas, things don't quite go to plan for the outward-bound duo, as a theft and unexpected trip into deep countryside await. Not only that, but there are encounters with an aggressive bull in a field and a terrifying truck driver to endure. Meanwhile, back at home, Lee's lovably feckless father Frank turns up to offer gifts - in his own inimitable way. Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Bobby Ball star

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May immerse themselves in nostalgia and try to prove that hot hatches from their younger days are better than today's equivalents. Jeremy grabs the keys to a Volkswagen Golf GTI, Richard takes the wheel of a Vauxhall Nova SRi and James May opts for the Ford Fiesta XR2i, and the trio set off on a road trip that includes a hill climb and a visit to a supermarket. However, their adventure concludes at an army training ground in Wales, where they and their steeds must face the heavily armed Top Gear Police Department. Downton Abbey star Hugh Bonneville blasts the Reasonably Priced Car around the test track

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event from Atlanta, Georgia where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill

programme.desc: US host Sean Kelly oversees UK bidders battling to win potential treasures found in storage containers, lock-ups and garages in Kent

programme.title: Not Going Out

programme.title: Villages by the Sea
programme.desc: Archaeologist Ben Robinson examines the history of Lindisfarne, which lies off the Northumberland coast. From what became known as the Holy Island of Lindisfarne, monks spread Christianity to the rest of northern England and created one of Britain's finest treasures - the Lindisfarne Gospels. Viking attacks caused the monks to flee but the village survived and today the community has to share it with thousands of tourists

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo has a go at playing Winchester Cathedral's Victorian organ as he continues his tour of Britain's railways. He also goes behind the scenes at a rail works in Eastleigh that began operating in the 19th century, and travels to the Isle of Wight, one of Queen Victoria's favourite holiday destinations

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the next stage of his journey to Wolverhampton, Michael Portillo visits Lacock Abbey near Chippenham in Wiltshire to find out how the world's first photographic negative was made. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: The six remaining potters discover their wild sides, as they create metallic-effect endangered animal sculptures fired in oil drums, before judges Keith and Rich set a surprise second challenge to throw a tall, thin-necked vase. Who will beast their way to the quarter-final, and who will be heading home?

programme.title: The Piano
programme.desc: The search for the most talented amateur pianist continues at Leeds train station. The unexpecting performers include a Chopin lover who has built a street piano on wheels, a boy who plays Ibiza classics for his dad and a unique girl who stops the station in its tracks

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: Paramedics and doctors rush to a man who has fallen headfirst down a flight of stairs outside a hospital. A woman calls an ambulance for both herself and her husband

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition begins in Stroud with horse trainer Melanie, who has opted for a quick and easy vegetarian menu so she can focus on a glamorous night of hosting - and partying

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Elliot hosts the second dinner party in Stroud and after making a good impression on radio presenter Kate, his guests are expecting big things. Tensions rise between Kate and fellow horse owner Mel as to who owns the most livestock leaving Belarusian rock fan Tasty and events manager Liv bored

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Belarusian rocker Tasty hosts the third night in Stroud and presents a taste of 'Mother Russia' inspired by her culture and heritage. Kate and Mel squabble yet again as they come up with roles for their newly formed band, Elliot's Angels, much to Liv's disapproval. With some Russian dancing and pretend figure skating it's an interesting night but will Tasty do enough to impress her guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the fourth evening in Stroud, Gloucestershire, marketing executive Liz incorporates her love of Italian food into her menu, hoping to impress her guests with large arancini balls, homemade ravioli and a rather lumpy panna cotta. Elliot feels his place at the top of the leaderboard is under threat, however Tatsy finds the constant chat about horses from Mel and Kate increasingly annoying

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On the final evening in Stroud, Gloucestershire, it's a battle of the risottos as radio presenter Kate produces one very similar to that made earlier by arch-rival Mel. However, Kate has a secret weapon in the shape of a magical table decoration that may help her clinch the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc: Spring arrives and after months of lockdown, the boys are all heading back to school, meaning Graham can get stuck in to project managing the house build. He and Sarah are planning a large dining room for entertaining, with a centrepiece table that used to belong to rock star Ronnie Wood. Artist Graham also draws on his skills to apply some decorative touches to the room - but will it be theatrical enough for Sarah? Meanwhile, the couple also visit a pig farmer who shows them the cycle from piglet to pork chop

programme.title: Sarah Beeny's New Life in the Country
programme.desc: Sarah and Graham turn their attention to the transformation of their sitting room. They have some elegant features planned, and for inspiration they visit Ford Abbey, a gothic grade 1 listed monastery, to soak up what grandeur looks like on a huge scale. But as well as building their dream house, they have 220 acres of farmland to think about and having tickled their tastebuds with cider last year, Graham buys four apple trees. It may not be an orchard, but it's a start

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Gary and Susie Gillhooly, who want to start a new adventure in Florida's beautiful Sarasota Keys. For their budget of £220,000 they're after a place to escape the British winters, as close to the amazing beaches of the Gulf of Mexico as possible. Jonnie shows them how far their budget will stretch in this highly desirable corner of the US

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Property expert Lee Juggurnauth jets off to Spain's Almería coast to help house-hunters Brian and Lorna find the perfect holiday home. The keen lawn bowlers plan to bring their pet dog Angus with them, so outside space is key. Lee shows them the very best of what their £150,000 budget can secure

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of house-hunters searching the Reading area. Kirstie is with Chloe, who wants a place in the trendy suburb of Caversham, and is joined on her search by her father Clive. However, after two years of looking and 60 properties viewed, the pair are struggling. Phil teams up with teachers Richard and Jo, who need to find a family home before term starts. But it needs to be a property good enough to get Richard excited

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is in Bournemouth, Dorset, with Mary Jane and Paul, single parents looking for the perfect home to bring their families together. However, a slow-moving market makes the search challenging with a first viewing that really does not go to plan. Phil Spencer is helping Alan and Nora, who have relocated to the seaside from Coventry with their four teenage children, and want to move on from their current rental property

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin goes house hunting in and around the Spanish town of Chiclana de la Frontera on the Costa de la Luz with Steve and Janice

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Fay Lewis has dreamed of moving to Spain for 20 years. Now, with her house in the UK sold and her bags packed, she's ready to take the plunge. Jasmine Harman shows Fay five properties around the Axarquia region of the Costa del Sol for her budget of 95,000 euros

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton helps motorbike enthusiast Jennie look for a home on the western Costa del Sol. With a budget of £85,000, Laura lines up five impressive properties

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil return to Edinburgh to visit Gary and Bill, after meeting them in 2020 to help them choose between to selling or renovating their house, to see what they decided. While Gary was packed and ready to move out of their four-bed Victorian cemetery lodge, Bill loved the unique features of their home and so the pair enlisted Kirstie and Phil's help

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Noel Fitzpatrick steps out of his comfort zone by heading to South Africa to spend time with the magnificent animals of the savannah and the selfless people who dedicate their lives to looking after them - often in very difficult circumstances. Noel meets the animals threatened by poaching, injured due to neglect in captivity, and exploited in one way or another. The pioneering vet also helps endangered rhinos and improve the lives of two big cats by performing procedures rarely - if ever - provided for wild animals before

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World (2003)
programme.desc: The captain of a British warship engages in a tense battle of wits and an escalating test of nerves with a French counterpart during the Napoleonic conflict, a pursuit that takes his crew on a dangerous journey along the coast of South America. Seafaring drama, adapted from Patrick O'Brian's novels, starring Russell Crowe, Paul Bettany, James D'Arcy, Billy Boyd and Edward Woodall

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics are back to tuck into their takeaways while watching the best of the week's TV and streaming output, sharing their thoughts for the rest of the viewing public to see

programme.title: Katie Price's Mucky Mansion
programme.desc: Katie Price is back and has her sights set on a five-room revamp of the top floor, turning it into her own little haven including a cinema room and a new bedroom. Plus the star opens up about threats she has received on social media and a surprise is in store when she finds a giant wasp nest in her storage container

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 50-year-old woman is rushed to A&E having collapsed at work following a thunderclap headache, leaving doctors concerned that she may have a bleed on her brain. Her husband shares the story of how they met and the challenges they have had to overcome. Other patients include a 13-year-old boy hit by a car while riding his bike and a woman concerned by a headache, who describes her childhood spent in Zambia and Lancashire

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Manor House Hotel in Haltwhistle, Northumberland, where guests Tony and Paula are immediately enamoured of their honeymoon suite

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&Bers visit Tom and Becky's Orchard Glamping in Lancashire hoping to prove their pristine pods are pitch perfect. Things are off to a good start but breakfast divides opinions

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Hotel Ellenby in Scarborough with hosts Tony and Paula who humbly reveal themselves as King and Queen of the town's hospitality scene, but their crowns slip at breakfast when the guests are not amused

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's final visit is to The Crown Inn in Derbyshire, where father-and-daughter team Dean and Abigail take great pride in their pub. The trip hits the skids when Terry and Rachel give their room a dusting down and Becky and Tom aren't taken in by the view

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to discover how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers and to air their grievances. There's a smorgasbord of slanderous sleep scores, brutal breakfast bombshells and even one couple declining the opportunity to face their competitors. Eventually, it is revealed who has won the competition

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Alex and Gino's glamping site in Spain is at risk of wildfires and James and Lauren find out if they have what it takes to host dream weddings at their 18th-century manor house in France. Restaurateur Lisa starts a new business venture

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: At Shelley and Mark's cycling holiday business in Spain, the duo are trying to get back in the saddle after a serious illness. Plus, an update on the fortunes of Sue and Joe's French astronomy-themed retreat

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A return visit to James and Annie's craft brewery in Portugal to see whether they have they successfully managed to crack the local market. Plus, cameras head back to Kevin and Lisa's kite surfing school in southern Spain to see if they're still flying high

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Diane and Gary are looking for an accessible holiday home with a pool in the all-year-round sunshine of Paphos on Cyprus. With three adult children and the recent arrival of their first grandchild, the couple can't wait to have all the family to stay, creating many years of happy memories together. Laura Hamilton sets out to find a property that keeps everyone happy on their budget of £130,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Ever since her daughter moved to Florida, Sandra Dodsworth has dreamt of following her across the Atlantic to make the full time move with husband Peter. With retirement now approaching, they are determined to find their perfect property in South Orlando. Armed with a budget of £110,000, Jonnie Irwin battles a fast-moving market to find them the best homes available on the market

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Carol and Stephen Howell from Bristol have been going to Barbados on holiday for years and now, with retirement fast approaching, hav decided it's time to buy a holiday home in their dream location. With a budget of £275,000 Jasmine Harman helps them to find their perfect property, whether it be a stunning hillside development or beachfront apartment

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Whitney and Rose have been married for eight years and dream about having their own holiday home around La Zenia on the Spanish southern Costa Blanca, where they can enjoy an all-year-round warm climate. Now, they feel the time is finally right for them to make their dream a reality and they're putting all their hopes in property expert Ben Hillman to find them something suitable on a budget of £80,000

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton meets Gill and Paul, a couple from Derbyshire who are searching for a holiday home in Benalmádena on Spain's Costa del Sol, on a £110,000 budget. It has been Gill's dream for at least 30 years to have a place that she can escape to during the cold, winter months

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Hazel searches for a holiday home in Malaga, with help from her friend Paula and guidance from Scarlette Douglas, who lines up five properties within her budget of £250,000

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Documentary following the staff of Woodgreen animal charity, who are committed to matching their homeless dogs with prospective owners. A lively French bulldog meets drag queen John and partner Sammy. Meanwhile, the unluckiest dog on Woodgreen's books, Peaches the lurcher, goes on not one but two dates
