programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc: Guy investigates the future of energy production, travelling to Orkney to look at how the Scottish islands are at the forefront of hydrogen research. He also joins the workforce at Europe's biggest building site and the Hinkley Point C nuclear power station, finding out why reactors are so expensive and take 10 years to build, and works inside Britain's most toxic site - handling nuclear waste inside the Sellafield facility

programme.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: The remaining recruits' will to survive is severely tested with an extraction task used in the Vietnam War, and there's an intense beasting in a fight for the survival of the fittest. With the hardships of the jungle closing in, a lack of sleep, a calorie deficit from ration packs, and their bodies starting to fail, will any of the recruits make it through a survival task that requires navigating through the jungle pursued by hunters during a mission behind enemy lines?

programme.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: The remaining recruits are ambushed and handed over to interrogators for questioning. They must endure psychological and physical punishments designed to break their will while sticking to their cover story. The end is near but will the final seven prove magnificent or not?

programme.desc: Speaking to people fighting back against Jeff Bezos's unprecedented power and uncovering how Amazon affects nearly every aspect of modern life

programme.desc: Hayley Leitch and her team go to the rescue of scout leader and single mother of two Debbie from south London, whose two-bedroom flat is drowning in clutter and filth. To make matters worse, Debbie's living room doubles up as her bedroom and then triples as her office

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers close in on a suspected stolen car near Tadcaster, but they have to deploy two stingers as the driver tries to escape by hitting speeds in excess of 100mph. programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: An insight into the working life of officers patrolling the nation's roads, using modern technology and old-fashioned methods to bring criminals to justice

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: The firearms team race to the scene of an alleged shooting, only to find themselves embroiled in an unconnected domestic incident. Elsewhere in the north of Nottingham, the knife crime team recognise the familiar face of a dealer they busted six months previously with a car full of cannabis

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A violent man gives officers the runaround after wreaking havoc in a hospital, a Macedonian truck driver has a bad day and a fuel thief is caught red-handed. Meanwhile, two Audi S3s are put through their paces by the team and the Operational Support Unit goes back to the classroom for a course about dealing with riots

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Sergeant Baxter strikes it lucky when a routine check on a car uncovers a case of suspected drug dealing, and things turn nasty when three men are arrested on suspicion of theft. Elsewhere, Jon Peacock brings in two prisoners, a petrol thief's stealing spree comes to a halt after a high-speed pursuit, and Jules and Jezz come to the aid of an abandoned dog in a ditch

programme.desc: The investigation into the death of Penny Beale in November 2001. Her boyfriend Michael Moffat claimed she fell down the stairs while drunk - but her mother knew better. To the police, Michael presented as a charming, helpful man who had been struggling to save his girlfriend from her alcohol and drug addictions. Penny's mother was aware of another side of him however - he was a drunk, abusive and violent man who was now trying to get away with her daughter's murder

programme.title: Cause of Death: The Coroner's Office
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of senior coroner for Lancashire and Darwen Dr James Adeley, who runs a team that works from the moment a body arrives in the mortuary through to the inquest, when the cause of death is determined. In the early hours of the morning, two elderly men are found semi-conscious with head injuries in the middle of a darkened stretch of road in Leyland, Lancashire. Police escalate their transfer to Preston Royal Hospital, but one of the men's conditions worsens and he dies. The surviving man has no memory of events, so it is up to the coroner to establish what happened that night, and determine the cause of death

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: While targeting cross-border thieves and fraudsters, officers are on the hunt for a car suspected of being used in supermarket thefts in a neighbouring county, while another intelligence-led operation identifies a car that is thought to be linked to drug dealing in North Yorkshire. In Scarborough, number plate recognition cameras identify a suspected stolen car, but when police attempt to pull it over, the car speeds off - and the chase is on. Jamie Theakston presents

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers pursue a 15-year-old driving a stolen Audi at 140mph down the M62, and track the theft of a VW Golf using automatic number-plate recognition cameras. Plus, police discover a boot full of stolen goods while attending the scene of a serious traffic accident. Jamie Theakston presents

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers are called to a serious accident near Skipton involving a motorbike, while a group of bikers get into an altercation with a motorist on the road to Harrogate, allegedly forcing him off the road and assaulting him. At the start of the Easter weekend, a rider loses control in a potentially fatal accident and a collision investigation unit is called to the scene

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Harrogate spot a youth behaving suspiciously, but when they try to stop him, he flees into a local housing estate and things rapidly escalate as a hostile crowd gathers. On the southern border of North Yorkshire, some more youngsters catch the eye of the traffic cops when it appears the driver is using a mobile phone. As they attempt to pull the car over, the suspects speed off and the chase is on. The police conduct a raid on a house near York, on the hunt for a suspected drug dealer, while a routine patrol takes a sinister turn when a man in a bar is spotted with a knife

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of high-speed interception teams, this time with access to the officers of Cumbria's Roads Policing Unit. Glen has a busy night in Barrow-in-Furness dealing with a drunk and a runaway knifeman, and Colin detains a suspected drug dealer who has a wrap of heroin hidden in a very intimate place. Countryside and city collide when Duggie has to tackle a trailer full of cows that has overturned, blocking the main carriageway into Carlisle, while the alcohol-fuelled actions of one driver send officers rushing to evacuate villagers in the middle of the night after a crash ruptures a gas main

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: A stick of dynamite causes chaos for Duggie when it is brought into Carlisle's main police station and the armed response unit is called out after there is a report of a gun being spotted in a city centre bar. Duncan receives a shock when a cyclist who has been trapped under a car turns out to be someone he knows, officers haul in a driver who is well over the limit and Hayley comes to the rescue when a teenager's car hits a wall during a late-night drive. Documentary following the work of Cumbria's Roads Policing Unit

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Ross and John put their armed-response training to the test when they tackle a suspected gunman, while teams are called out to deal with the results of dangerous driving after a person parks on a roundabout and a pedestrian is crushed under a car. Elsewhere, officers raid a cannabis farm, a Reliant Robin is bid a fiery farewell, and Phil finds out what happens when the driver of a Subaru Impreza decides to take on an HGV

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Duggie and Mark show that they are as quick on their feet as they are behind the wheel when a serial offender tries to give them the runaround. programme.title: NCIS

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.desc: Broadway star Marc Landry falls to his death after his flying harness fails during a performance of a play based on the Greek myth of Icarus. Goren also pays a visit to old friend and mythology lecturer Cleo Andrews for expert advice. Guest starring Cynthia Nixon and Patti Smith

programme.title: Law & Order: Criminal Intent

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Helicopter ER

programme.title: Helicopter ER

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

With the Crown failing to pull any profit, no pension in place and no Plan B, Alan is desperate for Alex's help

programme.title: Stone Age
programme.desc: Meet a group of typical suburban nine-year-old kids with friends, foes and families kicking it really old school, in prehistoric times

programme.title: Legend of the Dragon
programme.desc: The guardian of the temple has passed on and a new Golden Dragon must be Chosen from a brother and sister - Twins born in the Year of the Dragon. Only one will be chosen. Their sibling bond tested

programme.title: Space 1999
programme.desc: An unmanned craft from the past returns from deep space trailing death in its wake. Sci-fi adventure, starring Martin Landau and Barbara Bain

programme.title: Private Lives of the Tudors
programme.desc: Tracy Borman explores the life of Elizabeth I, looking into her relationships with her closest attendants and her attitudes to, and treatment of, other women

programme.title: Shine On Harvey Moon
programme.desc: Rita is depressed after only just escaping the clutches of murderer Neville Heath

programme.title: Dear John
programme.desc: A new face at the 1-2-1 Club is in need of sympathy and understanding as he reveals his past

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: London cabbie Mark Munroe takes you to the hidden and more quirky parts of this amazing city that normally lie undiscovered

programme.title: Crooks in Cloisters (1964)
programme.desc: Six train robbers hide from the law in a deserted monastery off the Cornish coast, where disguising themselves as monks proves the perfect way of lying low while carrying on with various criminal activities. But the crooks have a hard task keeping up the pretence when two real monks visit the island - especially since one of the gang is a woman. Comedy, with Ronald Fraser, Barbara Windsor, Bernard Cribbins, Wilfrid Brambell and Davy Kaye

programme.title: Once a Jolly Swagman (1949)
programme.desc: A former factory worker achieves fame and fortune as a professional speedway rider, at the expense of his marriage. Drama, starring Dirk Bogarde and Bonar Colleano

programme.title: Castle Builders
programme.desc: Examining the blood, sweat and vision behind Europe's castles, from the nobles' plans to the craftsmen's practical know-how

programme.title: Get Back
programme.desc: Martin needs to find a way to cover the cost of an Arsenal season ticket. With Ray Winstone, Larry Lamb and Kate Winslet

programme.title: Secrets of London with Mark Monroe
programme.desc: Exploring legends of London to get to the bottom of what's fact and what's fiction

programme.title: Dickensian
programme.desc: The Havishams throw a New Year's party. Amelia is delighted to be reunited with her brother Arthur, but is troubled when an unexpected guest joins the celebrations. Meanwhile, Frances Barbary rekindles an old friendship and allows herself to hope that it may develop into something more

programme.title: Mistresses
programme.desc: Already upset after demanding that Sally provide proof of Paul's infidelity, Trudi's mood is worsened by Richard trying to charm her back. Hari is furious when Siobhan does not make it to the clinic, where she knows her secret pregnancy would be revealed, and Jessica is unfulfilled following her liaisons with both Stella and her boss, Simon. Katie, however, suggests her symptoms point to her being in love

programme.title: A Shock to the System (1990)
programme.desc: A frustrated executive accidentally pushes a homeless man into the path of a subway train. Realising he has got away with one killing, he begins to wonder how many more murders he can pull off - starting with his rivals at work, his nagging wife and anyone else who has ever caused him misery. Black comedy, starring Michael Caine, Elizabeth McGovern, Peter Riegert and Swoosie Kurtz

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents
programme.desc: A satire on Hitchcock's distinctive interpretation of Daphne du Maurier's Rebecca. The maid Consuela receives a new mistress. Comedy, starring Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring Soho and Milllwall, with fascinating facts for locals and tourists alike. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.desc: The first baby is born on the moon, setting in motion a chain of strange events culminating in a battle for the fates of hundreds

programme.title: The Prisoner
programme.desc: Number Six faces a threat to his sanity in the midst of a masked ball, where he meets Peter Pan and Little Bo Peep and finds himself being placed on trial for making an audacious bid to foil his captors. Cult drama, starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: Cat Hospital
programme.desc: A look inside Ireland's first purpose-built clinic that caters exclusively for cats, nestled in the leafy environs of Glanmire outside Cork city. In this first episode, veterinary surgeon Clare Meade and her team meet the families of the cats they treat to try to understand their ailments. Biker Wolfgang worries that Paulina, the newest arrival to his feline family of 25, is having extreme difficulty breathing, Clare diagnoses a large growth in Paulina's throat and it looks like she will need to operate

programme.title: Danger Dogs
programme.desc: Documentary following dogs and their trainers as they are put through their paces in everything from sniffing out drugs to finding roadside bombs in conflict zones

programme.title: World Natural Heritage: Colombia
programme.desc: The UNESCO National Park Malpelo, located in the Eastern Pacific, 500k off the Colombian coast

programme.title: Sky West and Crooked (1965)
programme.desc: A gypsy boy falls for a fey 17-year-old girl who is treated with contempt by her fellow villagers, but the mismatched couple are soon subjected to the deep-seated prejudices of the locals. Romantic drama based on the novel by Mary Hayley Bell, starring Hayley Mills and Ian McShane

programme.title: Above Us the Waves (1955)
programme.desc: A Royal Navy commander sets out to win his admiral's confidence by launching secret midget submarine raids on the formidable German battleship Tirpitz, which is hiding in the fjords of Norway. However, as time unfolds, the mission becomes increasingly perilous. Second World War drama based on a true story, starring John Mills, Donald Sinden, John Gregson and James Robertson Justice

programme.title: Tales of Beatrix Potter
programme.desc: The Royal Ballet performs Frederick Ashton's family ballet, bringing to life Beatrix Potter's famous images and children's stories. Created for a film in 1971 featuring music arranged by John Lanchbery from popular Victorian and Edwardian melodies, the production brings to the Covent Garden stage such colourful figures as Jemima Puddleduck, Jeremy Fisher, Mrs Tiggywinkle, Mr Fox and the irrepressible Peter Rabbit

programme.title: Black Hairapy
programme.desc: Short documentary exploring the relationship between Afro hair and identity within the UK Afro-Caribbean community

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Change is on the way to the sleepy market town of Cranford as the railway pushes out from Manchester, but many of the female residents are more excited about the arrival of the handsome new doctor, Frank Harrison. Adapted by Heidi Thomas, with an all-star cast including Judi Dench and Eileen Atkins, who was awarded a Bafta for her role as the authoritative Miss Deborah Jenkyns

Thriller, starring Paddy Considine and Aiysha Hart

programme.desc: Number Six faces a threat to his sanity in the midst of a masked ball, where he meets Peter Pan and Little Bo Peep and finds himself being placed on trial for making an audacious bid to foil his captors. Cult drama, starring Patrick McGoohan

programme.title: World Natural Heritage: Colombia
programme.desc: The UNESCO National Park Malpelo, located in the Eastern Pacific, 500k off the Colombian coast

programme.title: Revolution in Colour
programme.desc: Part one of a two part documentary exploring the struggle for Irish independence in the early 20th century. Professor Eunan O'Halpin examines the years leading up to the 1918 British general election, which saw a rise in radicalisation among both Nationalists and Unionists

programme.title: Cranford
programme.desc: Change is on the way to the sleepy market town of Cranford as the railway pushes out from Manchester, but many of the female residents are more excited about the arrival of the handsome new doctor, Frank Harrison. Adapted by Heidi Thomas, with an all-star cast including Judi Dench and Eileen Atkins, who was awarded a Bafta for her role as the authoritative Miss Deborah Jenkyns

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Featuring Lee, Bermondsey and Stratford. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: Zoo Robbery ()
programme.desc: With Paul Gyngell. When the world's only yeti in captivity is kidnapped from London Zoo, a group of children succeed in rescuing it

programme.title: Once a Jolly Swagman (1949)
programme.desc: A former factory worker achieves fame and fortune as a professional speedway rider, at the expense of his marriage. Drama, starring Dirk Bogarde and Bonar Colleano

programme.title: Calamity the Cow (1967)
programme.desc: A farmer's children prepare a cow for a livestock show, but at the last moment, it is stolen by a rival. Children's comedy, starring John Moulder-Brown and Elizabeth Dear

programme.title: Lionheart (1968)
programme.desc: A lion escapes from a circus but is rescued and protected by a young boy. Children's drama, starring James Forlong and Louise Rush

programme.title: Tabernacle Choir: Music and Words
programme.desc: The Tabernacle Choir from Temple Square, Music and the Spoken Word, providing music and inspiration for everyday living from one of the world's top ten choirs featuring regular guest artists.

programme.title: Inside Tatler
programme.desc: Features editor Sophia Money-Coutts travels to castles in Scotland to find out what their owners think about Scottish independence and how their circumstances would be affected. Over in Moscow, the staff of Tatler Russia report on the country's emerging elite who are trying to create their own high society and look to British upper-class traditions to help them, with the magazine recommending the best UK boarding schools and hosting a debutante ball

programme.title: My Greek Odyssey
programme.desc: Peter Maneas journeys through some of the most spectacular Greek islands, exploring the rich culture, history and food of Greece while meeting the locals and those who live there

programme.title: Brighton (2019)
programme.desc: With Larry Lamb. Two working class couples go on a day trip to Brighton which ends in disaster

programme.title: Haraam (2018)
programme.desc: A man tries to pluck up the courage to profess his love to a departing co-worker of a very different cultural, ethnic and religious background before she leaves on her last day of work. Drama, starring Ainy Jaffri and Cherno Jagne

programme.title: The Comic Strip Presents
programme.desc: A satire on Hitchcock's distinctive interpretation of Daphne du Maurier's Rebecca. The maid Consuela receives a new mistress. Comedy, starring Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing Brixton and Harmondsworth for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: London Districts
programme.desc: Short visual tours exploring and revealing lesser known areas of London for locals and tourists. Narrated by Dewyne Lindsay

programme.title: The Great Train Robbery
programme.desc: First of a two-part drama by Broadchurch writer Chris Chibnall telling the story of the most infamous heist in British history, beginning with the planning and execution of the crime from the perspective of the perpetrators themselves. After a robbery at Heathrow Airport in 1962, Bruce Reynolds sets his sights on another target - the plan being to rob the overnight mail train from Glasgow to Euston. A team is assembled, schemes are laid out and rehearsals begin. But despite their meticulous planning, the operation is compromised by an attack on the train driver and a botched getaway. Before long, the gang have become the most wanted men in Britain. Luke Evans, Paul Anderson, Martin Compston, Jack Roth and Neil Maskell star

programme.title: Strike It Lucky
programme.desc: Michael Barrymore hosts the madcap game show, in which three teams of two prove seek to progress along a board game-style path by answering questions. Each duo are allowed to determine how many spaces they would like to move by answering the corresponding number of questions. programme.title: Live EFL Cup
programme.desc: Manchester United v Newcastle United (Kick-off 4.30pm). Live coverage of the final from Wembley Stadium. The Red Devils last lifted this trophy in 2017 and eliminated Aston Villa, Burnley, Charlton Athletic and Nottingham Forest to reach this showpiece occasion. Newcastle's last major domestic trophy of any kind came back when they won the FA Cup in 1955, but hopes will be high of them ending that long drought after victories over Tranmere Rovers, Crystal Palace, Bournemouth and Leicester City en route to this match
